header_summary: Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) update includes a reference implementation and caching strategy, explained by Steven Roose. Antoine Riard suggests solutions to address off-chain state equivocation. Johan Torås Halseth clarifies the importance of deterministic state tree building. Gijs van Dam and Tony Giorgio discuss decorrelated payments. Vincenzo Palazzo acknowledges an error and provides the correct link. ZmnSCPxj explains the implementation of the Decker-Wattenhofer mechanism for sidepools. These discussions cover a range of Bitcoin-related topics.

recent_posts.title: Draft BIP: OP_TXHASH and OP_CHECKTXHASHVERIFY
recent_posts.summary:
- The email presents an update to the draft BIP, including a reference implementation.
- The reference implementation demonstrates clear upper limits on hashed bytes for TXHASH.
- Steven Roose provides a link to the draft BIP and a cache implementation on GitHub.

recent_posts.title: Actuarial System To Reduce Interactivity In N-of-N (N > 2) Multiparticipant Offchain Mechanisms
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the issue of ensuring lack of equivocation in an off-chain state.
- The sender suggests two possible solutions: updating balance keys or designing a fraud-proof system.
- Fidelity bonds are proposed to prevent equivocation, with considerations for a coordinator's role.

recent_posts.title: MATT: [demo] Optimistic execution of arbitrary programs
recent_posts.summary:
- Johan agrees with aj about the typo and explains the correction regarding O(log n).
- They break the program into n steps and the commitment denotes how to create it.
- The participants agree on the trace length beforehand to ensure consistency and reject non-balanced state trees.

recent_posts.title: Payment Splitting & Switching and its impact on Balance Discovery Attacks (preprint)
recent_posts.summary:
- Gijs van Dam and Tony Giorgio discuss a concept related to decorrelated payments.
- Gijs believes the concept could aid decorrelated payments on an amount analysis level.
- Gijs refers to the concept as a step up after PTLC's and additional timing analysis protections.

recent_posts.title: Announcing the Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative
recent_posts.summary:
- Vincent acknowledges the error in his previous post and apologizes for any confusion caused.
- The correct link is not specified in this email but was provided in a previous post.

recent_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj discusses implementing a sidepool using the Decker-Wattenhofer mechanism with decrementing-nSequence.
- They mention numbers like stages, steps, and blocks per step, but note their limitations.
- The purpose of the sidepool mechanism is to balance channels through swap parties and updates.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- Simple covenants can enable the creation of Lightning channels for millions of casual users.
- Changing consensus rules to allow covenants can eliminate the bottleneck of obtaining signatures.
- Timeout-trees and off-chain transactions can greatly improve the scalability of Lightning.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes revisions and improvements, such as replacing OP_CHECK{IN, OUT}CONTRACTVERIFY with a single opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY.
- The code is implemented in the bitcoin-inquisition repo fork and includes basic functional tests.

active_posts.title: Solving CoinPool high-interactivity issue with cut-through update of Taproot leaves
active_posts.summary:
- The email discusses interactivity constraints in payment pools and channel factories, particularly regarding off-chain balances.
- Proposed solutions include introducing a coordinator and using external fidelity bonds to mitigate equivocation.
- The author presents a solution to prevent off-chain group equivocation by editing the funding utxo and using cut-through spends.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- Lightning's scalability problem for casual users can be solved using simple covenants.
- Timeout-trees can be utilized for long-term scaling and rollover of Lightning channels.
- Implementing protocols like CTV or APO would greatly enhance Lightning's scalability and usability.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to the bLIPs repository proposing a secure architecture.
- The architecture involves using a hardware security module as a whitelisted lightning peer.
- Bastien suggests implementing this idea and offers to contribute specifications and review the implementation.

active_posts.title: Practical PTLCs, a little more concretely
active_posts.summary:
- Greg discusses the importance of PTLCs as taproot channels are soon to be deployed.
- He shares a detailed gist on GitHub, exploring PTLCs and their various factors.
- Greg suggests his findings as a useful refresher and invites feedback and standardization discussions.
